clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy Study of Vitamin D to Treat Contrast-induced Nephropathy
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy Study of Vitamin D to Treat Contrast-induced Nephropathy

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators planned to research the effect of vitamin D supplementation on the incidence of contrast-induced nephropathy in patients undergoing coronary angiography.

detailed_description.textblock: Vitamin D is primarily generated in the skin, in response to direct absorption of ultraviolet B radiation. Vitamin D can also be obtained through fortified foods and oral supplements. Contrast-induced nephropathy (CIN) is a generally reversible form of acute kidney injury that occurs mostly within 2-3 days of exposure to contrast medium (CM). The estimated incidence of CIN ranges from 2%-50%, and coronary angiography (CAG) or percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI), or both, are associated with CIN in about half of cases. Recently low vitamin D status has been shown to be associated with increased risk of CIN. However, its effects on CIN patients remain unclear. The investigators planned to determine the efficacy of vitamin D on the incidence of contrast-induced nephropathy in patients undergoing coronary angiography. This study may shed light as to whether oral vitamin D supplementation can be an adjunct therapy in CIN patients.

primary_outcome.description: The primary efficacy variable was the prevalence of CIN between the vitamin D group and the control group.

secondary_outcome.measure: a change in serum creatinine level
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 1, 2, 3 days after percutaneous coronary intervention
secondary_outcome.description: The change in serum creatinine level was measured at 1, 2, 3 days after the procedure.

other_outcome.measure: differences in the incidences of treatment-emergent adverse events
other_outcome.description: Treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs): hypercalcemia, renal insufficiency, constipation

arm_group.description: drug: vitamin D3 tablets (Vigantoletten; Merck Pharma, Germany); the frequency: 2000 IU vitamin D3 tablets were taken daily; duration: study treatment was commenced 3 days before intervention and maintained for 3 days after the procedure.
drug: placebo tablets; the frequency: 2000 IU placebo tablets were taken daily; duration: study treatment was commenced 3 days before intervention and maintained for 3 days after the procedure.

intervention.description: 2000 IU vitamin D3 tablets were taken daily for 6 days
2000 IU placebo tablets were taken daily for 6 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The main inclusion criteria were patients who underwent coronary angiography.
Exclusion Criteria:
- The exclusion criteria were as follows: patients with chronic renal failure, chronic liver disease, bone disorders, and/or thyroid disorders.
- Patients were also excluded if they were taking vitamin D3 tablets or other lipid-regulating drugs.
